full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 467 Filed 11/15/21 Page 19 of 158 19 LBAAMAX1ps Rocchio - Direct

BY MS. POMERANTZ:
Q. In addition to your group practice, do you work anywhere else?
A. I do.
Q. Where do you work?
A. I'm on the voluntary faculty at Brown University, Alpert School of Medicine, in the department of psychiatry.
Q. What is your title?
A. I'm a clinical assistant professor.
Q. How long have you been at the Alpert Medical School of Brown University?
A. Since July 2020.
Q. What are your current responsibilities in your employment there?
A. I supervise psychiatry fellows in their efforts to learn how to conduct adult psychotherapy, and I also teach at some of the seminars that the psychiatry fellows attend.
Q. What sorts of things do you teach on?
A. When I'm asked to teach, I teach on areas related to traumatic stress and interpersonal violence.
Q. Dr. Rocchio, I'd like to show you Government Exhibit 1.
MS. POMERANTZ: Ms. Durocher, can you pull that up.
Q. Dr. Rocchio, what is that?
A. My curriculum vitae.
Q. Does it accurately describe your education and

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300

DOJ-OGR-00007198
